chapter.title: Build system
chapter.para:
I use Gradle as a build system. This includes building android and docbook, as well as the JavaFX application. Please refer to the gradle documentation for further information on how to use gradle. Basic hint:
~/beagle:$ gradle tasks #overview ~/beagle:$ gradle build #test and build ~/beagle:$ gradle reference #documentation

section.title: Structure
section.para:
This is a multi project build configuration. As for the folder structure seeProject Structure. Dependency and project version number are stored ingradle.properties, Besides the root build.gradle there are 4 separate gradle files:
android/build.gradle: contains android specific build.
doc/build.gradle: contains the docbook specific stuff to generate the reference documentation
libs/build.gradle: configuration for the different libs. Main goal is to keep the dependency trees as small as possible to enable reuse of those libraries.
pc/build.grale: contains dependencies and libraries to get the runnable JavaFX app.
